description: Tawbah is the sincere act of turning back to Allah after committing a sin. It reflects humility, self-awareness, and a believer’s desire to be cleansed from wrongdoing. No matter how great the sin, Allah’s mercy is greater, and He accepts sincere repentance from His servants.

importance.text: Indeed, Allah loves those who constantly repent and loves those who purify themselves.
Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins.'

conditions_of_accepted_tawbah: Feel deep regret and remorse for the sin
Resolve never to return to it
If the sin involved another person, return their rights or seek their forgiveness
etiquettes_of_tawbah: Make Tawbah as soon as you realize the mistake
Perform Wudu and offer 2 rakats of Salat al-Tawbah (if possible)
Raise hands in Dua and seek forgiveness sincerely
Mention Allah’s names of mercy (e.g. Ar-Rahman, Al-Ghaffar)

powerful_duas_for_tawbah.arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَتُبْ عَلَيَّ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
powerful_duas_for_tawbah.translation: My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

powerful_duas_for_tawbah.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي، لا إِلَهَ إِلا أَنْتَ، خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ...
powerful_duas_for_tawbah.translation: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is no god but You. You created me and I am Your servant... (Sayyid al-Istighfar)

hadiths.text: Every son of Adam sins, and the best of the sinners are those who repent.
Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than one who loses his camel in a desert and finds it again.

benefits: Forgiveness of sins, big or small

resources.book_reference: Repentance: Breaking the Habit of Sin by Ibn Qayyim
